content.description: Follow the line of jugs along the right side of the face.  A slight traverse left is necessary after making the ledge.
content.protection: Use the two bolts on the west side of the tower.
content.location: This is located on the west side of the Anvil Tower.  It is the route furthest right on the face.

content.description: Follow a series of jugs along the left side of the face.  The trickiest part is making the ledge just below the top.
content.protection: Use the two bolts on the west side of the tower.
content.location: This is located on the west side of the Anvil Tower.  It is the route furthest left on the face.

content.description: Follow a series of jugs up the face, watching out for loose flake.  A large dead tree is right next to the route, so a fall further up could send the climber into the tree if not careful.
content.protection: A top rope can be set up using a bolt from the east set and a bolt from the west set.
content.location: This is located on the north face of the Anvil Tower.  It is the only route on this side.

content.description: Start at a group of decent jugs in the center of the face.  As you progress upward, look for some solid crimps, and a few microholds above that.  A dyno may be required to make the ledge.
content.protection: Use the two bolts on the west side of the tower.
content.location: This is located on the west side of the tower.  It is the route running up the center of the face.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
